
================
eos.setupBeta
================

.. currentmodule:: nucleardatapy.eos.setupbeta

.. Don't include inherited members to keep the doc short
.. automodule:: nucleardatapy.eos.setup_beta
	:members:

Here are a set of figures which are produced with the Python sample: /nucleardatapy_sample/plots/plot_eos_setupBeta.py

.. figure:: ../../../version-0.2/nucleardatapy_samples/plots/figs/plot_eos_setupBeta_xp.png
	:scale: 70 %
	:alt: map to buried treasure

	This figure shows the proton fraction at beta-equilibrium. (left) Microscopic models and (right) phenomenological models available in the nucleardatapy toolkit.

.. figure:: ../../../version-0.2/nucleardatapy_samples/plots/figs/plot_eos_setupBeta_xe.png
	:scale: 70 %
	:alt: map to buried treasure

	This figure shows the electron fraction at beta-equilibrium. (left) Microscopic models and (right) phenomenological models available in the nucleardatapy toolkit.

.. figure:: ../../../version-0.2/nucleardatapy_samples/plots/figs/plot_eos_setupBeta_xmu.png
	:scale: 70 %
	:alt: map to buried treasure

	This figure shows the muon fraction at beta-equilibrium. (left) Microscopic models and (right) phenomenological models available in the nucleardatapy toolkit.
